member.summary: This class is the public API for the Countly Windows Phone SDK.

member.name: M:CountlySDK.Countly.StartSession(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Starts Countly tracking session. Call from your App.xaml.cs Application_Launching and Application_Activated events. Must be called before other SDK methods can be used.
member.param: URL of the Countly server to submit data to; use "https://cloud.count.ly" for Countly Cloud
app key for the application being tracked; find in the Countly Dashboard under Management > Applications

member.summary: This class provides static methods to retrieve information about the current device.

member.name: M:CountlySDK.Entities.Device.IsNetworkAvailable
member.summary: Indicates whether any network connection is available Filter connections below a specified speed, as well as virtual network cards.
member.returns: true if a network connection is available; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:CountlySDK.Entities.Device.IsNetworkAvailable(System.Int64)
member.summary: Indicates whether any network connection is available. Filter connections below a specified speed, as well as virtual network cards.
member.param: The minimum speed required. Passing 0 will not filter connection using speed.
member.returns: true if a network connection is available; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:CountlySDK.CountlyCommon.CountlyBase.RecordEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Records a custom event with no segmentation values, a count of one and a sum of zero
member.param: Name of the custom event, required, must not be the empty string
member.returns: True if event is uploaded successfully, False - queued for delayed upload

member.name: M:CountlySDK.CountlyCommon.CountlyBase.RecordEvent(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Records a custom event with no segmentation values, the specified count, and a sum of zero.
member.param: Name of the custom event, required, must not be the empty string
Count to associate with the event, should be more than zero
member.returns: True if event is uploaded successfully, False - queued for delayed upload

Count to associate with the event, should be more than zero
Sum to associate with the event
member.returns: True if event is uploaded successfully, False - queued for delayed upload
